channel.title: math.AT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On minimal bases in homotopical combinatorics
item.description: arXiv:2506.11159v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a development in the computational suite for the study of $N_\infty$ operads for a finite group $G$. This progress is achieved using the simple yet powerful observation that Rubin's generation algorithm can be interpreted as a closure operator. Leveraging this perspective, we establish the existence of minimal bases for $N_\infty$ operads. By investigating these bases for certain families of groups we are led to introduce and analyze several novel combinatorial invariants for finite groups.
item.dc:creator: Katharine Adamyk, Scott Balchin, Miguel Barrero, Steven Scheirer, Noah Wisdom, Valentina Zapata Castro

item.title: Twisted Graded Categories
item.description: arXiv:2506.11240v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Given a presentably symmetric monoidal $\infty$-category $\mathcal{C}$ and an $\mathbb{E}_{\infty}$-monoid $M$, we introduce and classify twisted graded categories, which generalize the Day convolution structure on $\mathrm{Fun}(M, \mathcal{C})$. These are characterized by a braiding encoded in symmetric group actions on tensor powers, whose character we show depends only on the $\mathbb{T}$-equivariant monoidal dimension. We analyze the $\mathbb{T}$-action on the dimension of invertible objects and identify it with the $\mathbb{T}$-transfer map. Finally, we compute braiding characters in examples arising from higher cyclotomic extensions, such as the $(\mathbb{S}, n+1)$-oriented extension of $\mathrm{Mod}_{En}^{\wedge}$ at all primes and heights, and of the cyclotomic closure of $\mathrm{Vect}^n$ at low heights.
item.dc:creator: Shai Keidar, Shaul Ragimov

item.title: Unstable $1$-semiadditivity as classifying Goodwillie towers
item.description: arXiv:2506.11245v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A stable $\infty$-category is $1$-semiadditive if all norms for finite group actions are equivalences. In the presence of $1$-semiadditivity, Goodwillie calculus simplifies drastically. We introduce two unstable analogs of $1$-semiadditivity for an $\infty$-category $C$ and study their relation to the Goodwillie calculus of functors $C \rightarrow \s(C)$. We demonstrate these qualities are complete obstructions to the problem of endowing $\partial_\ast F$ with either a right module or a divided power right module structure which completely classifies the Goodwillie tower of $F$. We find applications to algebraic localizations of spaces, the Morita theory of operads, and bar-cobar duality of algebras. Along the way, we address several milestones in these areas including: Lie structures in the Goodwillie calculus of spaces, spectral Lie algebra models of $v_h$-periodic homotopy theory, and the Poincar\'e/Koszul duality of $E_d$-algebras.
item.dc:creator: Connor Malin

item.title: Reflexive dg categories in algebra and topology
item.description: arXiv:2506.11213v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Reflexive dg categories were introduced by Kuznetsov and Shinder to abstract the duality between bounded and perfect derived categories. In particular this duality relates their Hochschild cohomologies, autoequivalence groups, and semiorthogonal decompositions. We establish reflexivity in a variety of settings including affine schemes, simple-minded collections, chain and cochain dg algebras of topological spaces, Ginzburg dg algebras, and Fukaya categories of cotangent bundles and surfaces as well as the closely related class of graded gentle algebras. Our proofs are based on the interplay of reflexivity with gluings, derived completions, and Koszul duality. In particular we show that for certain (co)connective dg algebras, reflexivity is equivalent to derived completeness.
item.dc:creator: Matt Booth, Isambard Goodbody, Sebastian Opper

item.title: Poincar{\'e} Duality, Degeneracy, and Real Lefschetz Property for T-Hypersurfaces
item.description: arXiv:2312.11919v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In this article, we present two structural results about the Renaudineau-Shaw spectral sequence that computes the cohomology of T-hypersurfaces. The first is a Poincar{\'e} duality satisfied by all its pages of positive index. The second is a vanishing criterion. It reformulates the vanishing of the boundary operators of the spectral sequence as the injectivity of some morphisms induced in cohomology by the inclusion of the T-hypersurface in its surrounding toric variety. It implies that the Renaudineau-Shaw spectral sequence of a T-hypersurface degenerates at the second page if and only if the T-hypersurface satisfies a real version of the Lefschetz Hyperplane Section Theorem.
item.dc:creator: Jules Chenal (LPP)

item.title: Modular vector fields in non-commutative geometry
item.description: arXiv:2410.24064v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We construct a non-commutative analogue of the modular vector field on a Poisson manifold for a given pair of a double bracket and a connection on a space of 1-forms. The key ingredient, the triple divergence map, is directly constructed from a connection on a linear category to deal with multiple base points. As an application, we give an algebraic description of the framed, groupoid version of Turaev's loop operation $\mu$ similar to the one obtained by Alekseev-Kawazumi-Kuno-Naef and the author.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Journal of Geometry and Physics, Volume 216, 2025, 105565, ISSN 0393-0440
item.dc:creator: Toyo Taniguchi

item.title: A Minimal Non Hausdorff Counterexample in Covering Space Theory
item.description: arXiv:2506.00031v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: This note presents a concrete and deliberately simple example that pinpoints why the Hausdorff condition on the total space is indispensable in classical covering space theory. Starting from the well known line with k origins, a one dimensional manifold that is non Hausdorff at exactly k isolated points, we embed a single copy of the real line in a punctured disc and collapse it onto the puncture. The resulting map behaves exactly like a k sheeted covering away from the puncture, yet every standard covering-space principle collapses at that single fibre: unique path and homotopy lifting fail, monodromy cannot be defined, and all deck transformations reduce to the identity. Because the total space is nevertheless contractible and otherwise well behaved, the example is minimal in both dimension and complexity. We verify that the map fits into none of the usual generalisations (branched covers,etale spaces, Brazas semicoverings) and outline why any future theory of covers over non-Hausdorff spaces will require genuinely new structure, perhaps of a stack-theoretic nature. The aim is not to overturn classical results, but to provide a clean test case and an invitation: extending covering theory beyond the Hausdorff world demands tools that can record fibres whose points are distinct yet topologically indistinguishable.
item.dc:creator: Abhiram Sripat
